value.title: Artificial intelligence keep expanding through a turbulent year, with some exceptions
value.excerpt: Stanford releases its latest AI statistics compilation, showing how the technology and associated opportunities fared through the turmoil of the past year.

value.title: Security & Safety Things offers AI based cameras to transform healthcare operations at lower costs

value.title: AI can be unintentionally biased: Data cleaning and awareness can help prevent the problem
value.excerpt: But how can organizations safeguard against systems so the AI doesn't inadvertently inject bias that affects the accuracy of results? Bias can be injected into AI by faulty algorithms, by lack of complete data on which the algorithms operate or even by ...

value.title: Nothing Personal, But Ethical AI Is Our Strongest Weapon In Data Privacy Wars
value.excerpt: Scary ‘surveillance society’ headlines that vilify artificial intelligence (AI) distract from this technology’s equally powerful ability to protect our personal data.

value.title: The Departure of 2 Google AI Researchers Spurs More Fallout
value.excerpt: Two academics changed plans to attend an invite-only conference this week; a third says he’ll no longer accept funding from the company.

value.title: Use of artificial intelligence to tackle coronavirus must go through ethical checks, say experts
value.excerpt: Rapid deployment of artificial intelligence and machine learning to tackle coronavirus must still go through ethical checks and balances, or we risk harming already disadvantaged communities in the rush to defeat the disease.

value.title: Use of AI to fight COVID-19 risks harming 'disadvantaged groups', experts warn
value.excerpt: The Leverhulme Centre for the Future of Intelligence recently launched the UK's first Master's course for ethics in AI. For Cave and colleagues, machine learning in the COVID era should be viewed ...

value.title: Preventing bias in AI is hard. Bug bounties could point the way forward
value.excerpt: Deborah Raji is researching ways to apply the models that underpin bug bounty programs to algorithmic harm detection.

value.title: Google might ask questions about AI ethics, but it doesn't want answers

value.title: The Chronicles Of AI Ethics: The Man, The Machine, And The Black Box
value.excerpt: Today, machine learning and artificial intelligence systems, trained by data, have become so effective that many of the largest and most well-respected companies in the world use them almost exclusively to make mission-critical business decisions.

value.title: AI Weekly: Facebook, Google, and the tension between profits and fairness
value.excerpt: Learn more. This week, we learned a lot more about the inner workings of AI fairness and ethics operations at Facebook and Google and how things have gone wrong. On Monday, a Google employee group ...

value.title: How one employee's exit shook Google and the AI industry
value.excerpt: Timnit Gebru, then co-leader of the ethical AI team at Google, sent a private message on Twitter to Emily Bender, a computational linguistics professor at the University of Washington.

value.title: Study: It might be unethical to force AI to tell us the truth
value.excerpt: Until recently, deceit was a trait unique to living beings. But these days artificial intelligence agents lie to us and each other all the time. The most popular example of dishonest AI came a couple years back when Facebook developed an AI system that created its own language in order to simplify negotiations with itself.

value.title: How The AI Sector Can Use Nonprofits As An Ethical Example
value.excerpt: A future in which the nonprofit sector is the driving force of our society, where our incentives to succeed aren't guided mainly by greed and self-sustenance but rather by our ability to do good. It's a future where we are measured and rewarded by our mastery of several key balances: profit and ethics;

value.title: Africa: The Ethics of AI to Ensure Food Security and Development
value.excerpt: Opinion - One year after the call for a group of international and religious organizations and important multinational companies to incorporate ethics into the design of artificial intelligence (AI),

value.title: There's no real AI revolution without ethics
value.excerpt: Tonya Hall interviews Matthew Bailey, author and CEO at AIEthics.World, about what governments and regulators need to do for AI to really benefit humankind.

value.title: KPMG: AI adoption accelerated too fast during the pandemic
value.excerpt: The outlook for artificial intelligence is optimistic under the Biden administration, but executives want industry regulation, a survey finds.

value.title: Underpaid Workers Are Being Forced To Train Biased AI on Mechanical Turk
value.excerpt: Workers who label images on platforms like Mechanical Turk say they are being incentivized to fall in line with their responses—or risk losing work.

value.title: Google employee group urges Congress to strengthen whistleblower protections for AI researchers
value.excerpt: A Google employee group wants Congress and state legislatures to strengthen whistleblower protection laws for AI ethics researchers.

value.title: As AI Tech Speeds Up, So Should Designed-In Gender Diversity
value.excerpt: These are the steps we need to take right now to make sure bias-free AI is developed by people representative of the whole of society and any given company.

value.title: Ethics by Design: Salesforce's approach for positive AI and product development
value.excerpt: Paula Goldman, Chief Ethical and Humane Use Officer for Salesforce, talks with ZDNet about how companies can develop technology, specifically AI, with ethical use and privacy in mind.

value.title: AI ethics: How Salesforce is helping developers build products with ethical use and privacy in mind
value.excerpt: Salesforce's Ethics by Design program is designed to put ethics and privacy at the center how technology, specifically AI, is developed and used.

value.title: Google Billionaire Eric Schmidt Warns Of 'National Emergency' If China Overtakes U.S. In AI Tech
value.excerpt: Former Google CEO Eric Schmidt on Sunday urged lawmakers to ramp up funding for research and development in the artificial intelligence space in order to prevent China from becoming the biggest player in the global AI market–a development Schmidt warned would spark national security and privacy concerns that could ultimately constitute a national emergency.

value.title: UW’s Os Keyes takes on tech’s ethical challenges, from gender bias in AI to facial recognition
value.excerpt: A PhD candidate with the University of Washington's Department of Human Centered Design & Engineering, Os Keyes researches the ethical and political impact that new technologies have on the world.

value.title: IDC: Ethical AI is a team sport that requires smart and strong referees
value.excerpt: New research finds that the lack of responsible artificial intelligence guidelines is one of the top three barriers to wider adoption.

value.title: How This AI Ethics Researcher Combines Anthropology And Technology To Build Human-First Solutions
value.excerpt: My work as a tech anthropologist revolves around the study of the interaction between people and digital solutions, the changing nature of technology and its impacts on society

value.title: Inside 'TALON,' the Nationwide Network of AI-Enabled Surveillance Cameras
value.excerpt: Hundreds of pages of emails obtained by Motherboard show how little-known company Flock has expanded from surveilling individual neighborhoods into a network of smart cameras that spans the United States.

value.title: Annual index finds AI is ‘industrializing’ but needs better metrics and testing
value.excerpt: AI Index from Stanford University gathers data about how AI research, startups, and changes to business and government policy.

value.title: AI ethics research conference suspends Google sponsorship
value.excerpt: The ACM Conference for Fairness, Accountability, and Transparency (FAccT) decided to pause its sponsorship relationship with Google.

value.title: How AvePoint is Leveraging Microsoft Turing and AI at Scale to Advance Corporate and Higher Education Learning
value.excerpt: AI is the future and the Microsoft Turing model is the key. Click here to learn about AvePoint's latest venture into artifical intelligence.
